channel.title: Darkness II
channel.description:
So, yeah, while everyone talkin about bulletstorm I sneak in with thhe new Darkness, since gamespot issued a hands-on. Not sure (and don't care) if you heard of or played the first one, but here goes: [img]https://www.gamesthirst.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/darkness-IIresized.jpg[/img] Starbreeze is not involved (fuck), instead we have digital extremes who decided to make the game cel-shaded. While it looks decent when minimized, it will surely look cheap and crap in HD. Yeah. But we do get quad wielding (shoulders for guns, triggers for heads) action, which is pimpin, defs. Tentacles are given much more attention than previously. Not getting into much details, but there will be a lot of combos involving them. Phil Hester (writer) and Mike Patton (Voice actor for Darkness) make return, which is pimpin too. [img]https://image.gamespotcdn.net/gamespot/images/2011/055/reviews/621308_20110225_screen001.jpg[/img] [img]https://image.gamespotcdn.net/gamespot/images/2011/055/reviews/621308_20110225_screen002.jpg[/img] [img]https://image.gamespotcdn.net/gamespot/images/2011/055/reviews/621308_20110225_screen003.jpg[/img] [img]https://image.gamespotcdn.net/gamespot/images/2011/055/reviews/621308_20110225_screen004.jpg[/img]
Mags obviously droolin. [url]https://www.gamepro.com/article/previews/218396/gdc-the-darkness-2-preview/[/url] [url='https://www.gamespot.com/xbox360/action/thedarkness2/news.html?sid=6301032&om_act=convert&om_clk=newsfeatures&tag=newsfeatures%3Btitle%3B1&mode=previews']https://www.gamespot.com/xbox360/action/thedarkness2/news.html?sid=6301032&om_act=convert&om_clk=newsfeatures&tag=newsfeatures%3Btitle%3B1&mode=previews[/url]
Also picked up brittish games tm mag. Well they're droolin too. The mag itself glows in the dark which is PIMPIN [img]https://www.gamestm.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/GTM-glow-in-the-dark-600.jpg[/img]

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
https://www.gametrailers.com/video/e3-2011-the-darkness/714958
Yeah, well, okay

Still hate the plain textures with no hint of detail (DATED is the word), still don’t buy the atrocious Nolan North work. Seriously, what the fuck with that generic american voice? Thank god there’s hope that he is a freaking placeholder.

Also, fucking green and purple. It’s Diablo 3 all the fuck over again, damn.
And these + points… eh?

Good thing you can still rip people’s hearts. And some moments look really good, like the back alley, tho I suspect it’s mainly because it’s dark in there. As soon as he hit the street tho… jeez some of the stuff looks horrible. Is hand-painted the excuse for not having any details to the environments at all? Sure, character models look okay (albeit fucking borderlands), but it’s like they made it in 2002.

Get rid of stupid purple, kick NN the fuck out and maybe it will get better.

EDIT: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YDNNOgb9S7k&feature=player_embedded

Read full topic

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
xalener:

I live in Jersey

The profuse swearing that comes from you makes sense all of a sudden.

BUT GET OUT OF THERE, MAN. AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
E3 trailer.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q43plsob1T4&feature=player_embedded

But really, wtf is this oversaturated cartoon? And why does it have Darkness logo at the end?
So the main protagonist turned out to be a fucking circus freak clown. Great.

It’s like the first game never existed.
So yeah, you may as well fap at this shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
I’m merely listing things that I’m not looking for in the Darkness game…
Points-awarding mechanic is one of them.

And I’m mostly fine with how the graphic engine looks.
I’m more pissed off with arcade elements that are being hinted at.

Also, the north american mentality of ‘wow’ and ‘badass’ (+ ‘we gotta have this in’) really gets on my nerves.
I’m more pissed at the retarded people rather than at the game itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
I kinda get what they’re going for here.

I can’t really get mad about inaccuracies or lack of consistency to the first game anymore, because they’re obviously going for something completely different.

ps: I can’t really see what’s wrong with the hooker’s faces, but yeah. That hair pisses me the fuck off. There are so many better ways to do it that would actually fit their style BETTER.
I also fail to see exactly got dumbed down, only a more in depth (and a bit more arcadey) combat system. I’m pretty sure he was dodging story related questions because it’s too early to get real into it.

I’m not gonna get mad. I’ve had enough of getting mad. I’m just gonna take it for what it is, because it’s not Starbreeze’s darkness. Whether or not that’s a good thing I’ll find out when I play the demo myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: The_can
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

Also, wtf is that shiny purple thing that swirls around after the kill?
Fucking gay.

Agree. I hate when games have that gimmicky shit where glowing orbs (or in this case purple orbs) pop up after every kill which you have to collect.
It’s okay in maybe arcade games but in games that are supposed to be serious it just ruins the immersion.

Read full topic

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Those stripper’s faces are ugly as heck and are as badly modelled as humanely possible.

…

FUCKING HAIR

Interior looks great, sans those stupid fucking square dishes… as soon as I saw outside footage, I sighed.

Also, wtf is that shiny purple thing that swirls around after the kill?
Fucking gay.

That last bit in the dark alleyway looked awesome.
If only not for this cel-shaded monstrosity.

One can conclude that the atmosphere of the first Darkness… is gone.
Every motherfucking thing is comical.

P.S. Gametrailers updated.
https://www.gametrailers.com/game/the-darkness-ii/14491
They look like they lifted an embargo on it.
The voice acting Nolan North is doing is so fucking not Jackie.

Some of the things that guy said, makes me conclude that giving the license to DE was the worst mistake possible.
Quick glimpse at comments made me puke.
I love how in the story interview he talks about action.

From what they’ve shown, shit got dumbed down 100%.
Like that ‘Essence’ thing granted for kills. Are they fucking retarded?
That ‘Jenny, is that you?’ part was so awkwardly trivial and unconvincing.

Demon arms look like shit, they look like a pair of thin intestines… there’s hundreds of things that get a -1.

Read full topic

ey, it actually doesn’t look all that bad in motion.

It’s also a pretty bad quality vid though.

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
https://www.ausgamers.com/features/read/3061679

There is a hub in the game – we’re not giving away too much about that just yet, but there is one; it still features a full dialogue system; you’re going to have conversations with characters: returning characters like Aunt Sarah, Jimmy the Grape. Those people are still going to be there for you to interact with in the world and kind of puzzle out what the story’s all about.

  • 1 point.

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
https://www.thelondoner.ca/ArticleDisplay.aspx?e=3121239
The main villain is Victor Velente and he comes from the Brotherhood.

Also lolzers:
https://www.computerandvideogames.com/301118/news/the-darkness-2-to-star-nolan-north/
Nolan North is unconfirmed. YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYAAAAAAAAAAAA… but oh wait:
https://www.computerandvideogames.com/301130/previews/the-darkness-2-does-a-new-direction-cast-doubt/
It looks hilariously awful and cheesy. And not even the graphics themselves, but the locales and the outfits.
May look good? High res it. Jagginess, broken textures… But hey, those pants actually look hand-painted.
Also, why is everything so fucking bright? I’m pretty sure the game isn’t called the Brightness?

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
xalener:

Nolan North’s Jackie seems more exaggerated mob boss guy. I guess it fits more with this game’s over the top style.

More like boring and generic peter parker crap… since when did a mob boss guys start to have a Jersey Shore accent?
But seriously, it’s inconsistent and lame. There’s absolutely nothing about his voice that clings.

item.title: Darkness II
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Nolan North’s Jackie seems more exaggerated mob boss guy. I guess it fits more with this game’s over the top style.

mankyman6:

Cell Shading = Excuse not to put any effort into how a game looks

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mUkyGeJXLbg&hd=1

Nope.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZloCD06QjiE

Nope.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7rhvLebx1iA

Nope.

It’s actually quite the opposite. Heavy stylization just means more work on the drawing board. You have to actually think to make a game look unique. The problem here is, with the Darkness II, they didn’t. It just looks like regular realistic models with outlines and smudged textures. Like I said, it’s got the same problem as Borderlands. It doesn’t take advantage of it’s style at all.

Read full topic
